pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.7: For the rendering of _gihigatā_ as “married girl”,  see the Appendix of Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.12: The Pali text just says _dukkaṭa_, without specifying that it is an _āpatti_, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at [pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.65](), the _dukkaṭa_ is annulled if you commit the full offense of _saṅghādisesa_. The implication is that in these contexts _dukkaṭa_ should be read as _āpatti dukkaṭassa_, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
